result.execSummary:
The defendant Xzavier James Guerrero was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: To any other sentence.

Concurrent with: *With the probation ordered in case #15CF2067.
*Court opposed expungement.

miscConds.notes:
*Pay all court costs and disbursements by the end of supervision. failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
-If revoked, the court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining  due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

*Obtain GED.
*Seek and maintain employment.
*Participate in vocation/job training programs.

*NO use of controlled substances without valid prescription, and only as long as medically appropriate for physical or mental health.
*NO Alcohol.
*NO contact with Jutiki J. or his residence.

*Complete mental health evaluation and any recommended treatment.
*Anger Management counseling.
*Cognitive thinking intervention counseling.
*Provide a DNA sample, if one was not already provided in  case #15cf2067 (pay the surcharge).

*Random urine screens.
*AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (30 pages) commencing JULY 24, 2015, received and filed.  jm

Defendant Xzavier James Guerrero in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant Xzavier James Guerrero in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

As to Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a term of IMPRISONMENT of 60 DAYS with 4 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program but is NOT eligible for the WI Substance Abuse program. 

The Court stayed the sentence and placed the defendant on 1 YEAR probation.  This is to be CONCURRENT to the probation ordered in case #15CF2067.


Conditions of Probation:
-Complete a mental health evaluation and any recommended treatment
-No use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, and only as long as medically appropriate for physical or mental health
-No alcohol
-Random urine screens
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Obtain GED
-Seek and maintain employment
-Participate in vocation/job training programs
-Anger management counseling
-Cognitive thinking intervention counseling
-Provide a DNA sample, if was one was not already provided in case #15CF2067 (pay the surcharge)
-No contact with Jutiki J. or his residence

Court ordered the defendant pay all court costs and disbursements by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
-  If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

Court opposed expungement.

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Xzavier James Guerrero in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant Xzavier James Guerrero in custody. 
 Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Case transferred from Branch 47 to Branch 20 for the purpose of global resolution with 15CF002067.  Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Status conference scheduled for 07-08-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez in court, defendant Xzavier James Guerrero not in court, in custody.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has a pending case in Branch 20.
Defense counsel informs Court there is a possible global resolution to this case.  Court will allow case to be transferred to Branch 20, providing they are willing to accept the case.
Defense counsel's withdrawal from this case is approved by the Court and Court orders case adjourned to Branch 20 for status.
Clerk:  jms

Attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez in court, defendant Xzavier James Guerrero not in court, in custody.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Pending felony in branch 20.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch
 47. lr  Status conference scheduled for 06-24-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez in court, defendant Xzavier James Guerrero not in court, in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court preapproves transfer to branch 20 for global resolution if accepted.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 47. lr  Status conference scheduled for 06-08-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Xzavier James Guerrero in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial  in Branch 47.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 05-12-2015 at 08:30 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Xzavier James Guerrero in court with attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices.  Defendant Xzavier James Guerrero in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: tmk. 
 Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
